question: Claire has a flower bed that is 138 feet long. Claire wants to fill her flower bed with plants. Claire's flowers grow 8 inches wide so she needs to leave 11.75 feet between every plant. Claire already owns 11 flowers. Each flowering plant costs £4 at the store, how much money will Claire spend at the store to fill up her flower bed?
answer:
Claire's flower bed is 138 feet / 11.75 feet per plant = <<138/11.75=11>>11 plants needed.
Claire needs to buy 11 plants - 11 plants = <<11-11=0>>0 plants needed to purchase.
Claire will spend 0 plants * £4 = £<<0*4=2>>2.
#### 2
